processed.result:
You are given a grid of size $n \times m$ where '.' represents an empty cell and '*' represents a filled cell. You need to cover all the empty cells with 1x2 tiles.  

A tile can be placed horizontally (represented by "<>") or vertically (represented by "^v").  

* If there is no way to cover all empty cells, print "Not unique".
* If there are multiple ways to cover all empty cells, print "Not unique".
* If there is only one way to cover all empty cells, print the solution using "<>" and "^v" to represent the tiles.

Given a grid of cells, some empty and some occupied, determine if it's possible to cover all empty cells with rectangular tiles that are 1 cell wide and 2 cells long, without overlapping. If possible, show one way to do this. If not possible or there are multiple solutions, say "Not unique".
